comments: Prof Romero is a gem! He explains Psychology so profoundly through examples that we can relate to. He makes you think. Doesn\'t use textbook but doesn\'t have to. He\'s available before and after class. Makes you become a better you! You have to participate though and ask questions to understand yourself. Man! He could be the next Jordan Peterson!

comments: I took his online PSYCH 1 course. I found it to be straight forward. Just do the reading & assigned material and you will do great. He responds to all your e-mails if you\'re respectful as you should be. Conduct yourself in a professional manner and you will have no issues.

comments: Lectures go absolutely nowhere, but the class is easy to pass. Spends most of class rambling about his prostate, doesnt talk about psychology almost at all. One of the worst professors ive ever had, wouldnt recommend unless youre okay with sitting in a boring class and getting an easy A.

comments: Dr. Romero is one of the best professors I have taken here at RCC. He can seem rude and opinionated but he has a very unusual way to deliver his message/lecture. As a psych professor he teaches you how to think and use psychology to develop profiles. Expect to read a fair amount because his quizzes are based on the book chapter.

comments: Easy A if you read and take the online quizzes, however, you will not get anything out of this class!!! I do not doubt he is an intelligent man, but, all the learning comes from reading the text on your own, you will not get much out of lecture. I do not recommend unless you don\'t care much about school and want an easy A.

comments: Professor Romero is awesome ! I do not understand how anyone could give a negative review. Students need to apply what they learn. The class is not intended to be simple .... its psychology !! Think outside of the box. Romeros instruction is as raw as it gets. Apply yourself and the theories and you will do well.

comments: Rarely gives explanation to anything he is talking about. You can show up to every class and still be confused. He wants the class to know all the material without him actually teaching it. He is over the top inappropriate, vulgar, and rude. He seems to like picking on people that don\'t have his sense of humor obviously making them uncomfortable.

comments: Quiz every week as well as online quizzes. He told us to buy 3 books but we only used one (for the final). And these were novels not textbooks about psychology. Assigned people grades for this final without even taking a legit test. He asks you what you think your grade is at the end of semester so keep track. Hardly lectures about psychology.

comments: Attendance isn\'t mandatory, but you sign next to your name on the roll sheet for credit. Online quizzes and in-class quizzes once a week. Three books to read--one book you will write a final essay on. Be careful: you still could get an F after showing up every day & being apart of the final debate. I do not recommend--he\'s messy & vulgar. Stay away

comments: It is terrible to take his class. He is not replying your email until your second email. I got B grade in average, but because of his non-scene judgement. He asked me to take the final exam again with his presence because I got a high score on my final exam, but he knew that I am out of states. Ridiculous!

comments: In general, this class could have been very easy if I did the work and read all the material. His online class is a simple few quizzes which you will do bad in no matter what if you don\'t do the reading. He was very understanding and replied to all my messages. A textbook code is required to register online, but there is an online reading program.

stu_tags: TOUGH GRADER  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.  PARTICIPATION MATTERS
comments: Attended every class, got good grades on every quiz. I got a 100% on the written final (there was an in class literature final and an online curriculum final), yet put an 80% in the grade book. His incompetence left me with a B instead of an A. KEEP TRACK OF YOUR GRADES ALL SEMESTER. Call him out on his mistakes when it comes to your grades.

comments: If you can\'t handle his class, don\'t call yourself a psych major. He is not a typical take notes kind of teacher. Yes, you do have to read and they\'re quizzes which i didn\'t do so well on myself, but he let me pass because of who I am. If you show him you are not an idiot you will pass. He does have a shocking sense of humor.

comments: He does not explain the material well, expects you to know the material with out explanation. He curses a lot. There is a ridiculous amount of reading. His lectures consist of you lecturing him and if you do not understand be prepared to get picked on. His attitude is very arrogant. If you memorized the whole book, you will "probably" pass.
